chargeHist.descr: Drive or Operate Vehicle w/o Consent
Drive or Operate Vehicle w/o Consent

result.execSummary:
The defendant Barry Allen Waters was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Barry Allen Waters is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Barry Allen Waters was found guilty of Drive or Operate Vehicle w/o Consent [Modifiers: Repeater], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.23(3).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
- Court reserves on restitution amount for 30 days

- 114 days credit against ultimate sentence 

- In the event that the defendant is revoked or discharged from either probation or extended supervision with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victim(s) and/or governmental entities for any balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.
Concurrent with: any other status Defendant is currently serving

1:51 PM Apprs: CO: S. Needham, Rpr: V. Kasten, Clerk: B Harris, Defendant Barry Allen Waters in court, in custody.  Attorney Travis Satorius in court for Barry Allen Waters.  Prosecuting attorney Aaron M. Damrau in court for the State of Wisconsin. Atty Satorius states there is an agreement and recites joint recommendation.  Attorneys make statements. Court reads charge and maximum penalty. DE pleads NC to Ct 1- Drive or Operate Vehicle w/o Consent Repeater in 22CF392.  DE sworn. Crt reviews plea questionnaire and informs DE of rights. Crt finds DE freely, voluntarily and knowingly waives rights and makes plea. Attorney's stipulate to the facts. Crt accepts plea, finds factual basis and finds DE guilty of Ct 1 in 22CF392. On motion of the State without objection, Crt dismisses Ct's 2-4 in 22CF392.  Sentencing arguments. Court reserves on restitution amount for 30 days. 

Court Orders: Ct 1 in 22CF392

S/W 2 Years Probation- Concurrent with any other status DE is currently serving

- Court Costs: $268     
- DNA Sample and Surcharge: $250
To be paid through Probation

Conditions of Probation:

120 Days County Jail
- No Contact with G. Rusch
- Comply with programming that agent recommends
- Pay supervision fees
114 days credit against ultimate sentence

- It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, Gerald R. or his residence.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, social media including but not limited to texting, Facebook, Twitter, contact through the mail, and/or through a third person.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

- Not to possess any concealed knives or firearms.

If the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bail jumping.
